org.foxlabs.validation

Class Validator.Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.foxlabs.validation.Validator.Context
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValidationContext<T>
    Enclosing class:
    Validator<T>

    protected class Validator.Context
extends Object
implements ValidationContext<T>
    This context holds current validation state.
    Author:
    Fox Mulder
    See Also:
    Validator.ContextBuilder

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected T currentEntity
      Current entity we are validating.
      protected Object currentIndex
      Current item index we are validating.
      protected ValidationTarget currentTarget
      Current validation target we are validating.
      protected ElementMetaData<T,?> elementMeta
      Current element metadata we are validating.
      protected boolean failFast
      Determines if validation should fail on the first violation.
      protected boolean localizedConvert
      Determines if converters should take locale into account.
      protected Locale messageLocale
      Locale to be used for error messages and formatting numbers, dates, etc.
      protected ValidationContext<?> parent
      Parent context in case of cascade validation.
      protected PropertyFilter propertyFilter
      Filter to be used for property filtering.
      protected String[] validatingGroups
      Array of constraint groups we are validating.

      • getIntegerFormat

        public final NumberFormat getIntegerFormat()
        Returns default format of integer numbers for locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). The format returned is based on the pattern that was configured by the validator factory. If default pattern is not configured then integer number format supported by JRE will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getIntegerFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Returns:
        Default format of integer numbers.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getIntegerFormat()

      • getIntegerFormat

        public final NumberFormat getIntegerFormat(String pattern)
        Returns format of integer numbers for the specified pattern and locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). If the specified pattern is null then default format will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getIntegerFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Parameters:
        pattern - Integer number pattern.
        Returns:
        Format of integer numbers for the specified pattern.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getIntegerFormat(String)

      • getDecimalFormat

        public final NumberFormat getDecimalFormat()
        Returns default format of decimal numbers for locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). The format returned is based on the pattern that was configured by the validator factory. If default pattern is not configured then decimal number format supported by JRE will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDecimalFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Returns:
        Default format of decimal numbers.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getDecimalFormat()

      • getDecimalFormat

        public final NumberFormat getDecimalFormat(String pattern)
        Returns format of decimal numbers for the specified pattern and locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). If the specified pattern is null then default format will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDecimalFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Parameters:
        pattern - Decimal number pattern.
        Returns:
        Format of decimal numbers for the specified pattern.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getDecimalFormat(String)

      • getDateFormat

        public final DateFormat getDateFormat()
        Returns default format of dates for locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). The format returned is based on the pattern if it was configured by the validator factory. If default pattern is not configured then date format based on date and time styles will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDateFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Returns:
        Default format of dates.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getDateFormat()

      • getDateFormat

        public final DateFormat getDateFormat(String pattern)
        Returns format of dates for the specified pattern and locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). If the specified pattern is null then default format will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDateFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Parameters:
        pattern - Date pattern.
        Returns:
        Format of dates for the specified pattern.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getDateFormat(String)

      • getDateFormat

        public final DateFormat getDateFormat(int dateStyle,
                                      int timeStyle)
        Returns format of dates for the specified date and time styles and locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale(). If both of the specified styles are negative values then default format will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDateFormat in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Parameters:
        dateStyle - Date style.
        timeStyle - Time style.
        Returns:
        Format of dates for the specified date and time styles.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.getDateFormat(int, int)

      • resolveMessage

        public final String resolveMessage(String key)
        Returns localized message for the specified key and locale returned by the method ValidationContext.getMessageLocale().
        Specified by:
        resolveMessage in interface ValidationContext<T>
        Parameters:
        key - Key of a message in a bundle.
        Returns:
        Localized message for the specified key.
        See Also:
        ValidationContext.resolveMessage(String)
